newsitem.title: USA: Acclaim embarked on cost-cutting plan.
newsitem.headline: Acclaim embarked on cost-cutting plan.

text.p: Acclaim Entertainment Inc said on Thursday that it had embarked on a cost cutting plan to eliminate 115 positions at its Glen Cove headquarters, consolidate administrative and operational functions and reduce operating budgets in a bid to reach annualized savings of about $40 million.

"It is anticipated that through the implementation of these measures that the company will become cash-flow positive based on our current operating plans," said Gregory Fischbach, Acclaim president and chief executive officer.
In April, the company reported a second quarter loss of $16.8 million, compared with a $55.8 million loss for the same quarter in 1996.
Acclaim Entertainment is a publisher of software for video game and personal computer hardware systems and also publishes comic books under a variety of imprints.
